image.altText: man in van with mobile phone sitting on lap

props.synopsis: Mobile detection cameras have so far caught thousands of drivers using their phones illegally in Adelaide. But some have discovered you might still be doing the wrong thing, even if you are not touching your phone with your hands.

title.children: 'I was quite shocked': Drivers in Adelaide receive fines, demerit points for resting phones on laps

image.altText: A graphic of a speed limit for a 90kph zone.

props.synopsis: Driving in later life can bring its own challenges, and while rules around older road users vary widely across the country, options for navigating those challenges include licence assessments and conversations around so-called "driving retirement".

title.children: What are the rules for older Australian drivers?

image.altText: Baby Kobi sits against a white background smiling wearing a white shirt and flowery pants

props.synopsis: The "main issue" for police handling domestic violence matters is finding a way to encourage coercive control victims to confide in them when non-contact orders have been breached, a senior police officer has told the inquest into the murder-suicide of Kobi and Henry Shepherdson.

title.children: Senior police officer tells inquest DV victims must be encouraged to report non-contact breaches

image.altText: Powerlines built through a clearing in a forest

props.synopsis: The South Australian government is urgently seeking to restart two mothballed diesel-powered generators as it warns the state is at risk of blackouts this summer.

title.children: SA government seeks new powers to get diesel generators back online ahead of peak summer period

image.altText: close up of stone pub called the Parkside Hotel

props.synopsis: A national company appears to walk back a reported notice to venue managers about celebrating Australia Day on January 26, saying in a statement its comments caused "concern and confusion".

title.children: Hospitality group apologises after reportedly telling pubs not to celebrate Australia Day

image.altText: The sun beams through buildings on Adelaide's Hindley Street.

props.synopsis: With parts of the country already sweltering though heatwaves, support services are worried many people will not be able to afford to keep cool this year.

title.children: Above-average temperatures for summer prompt concerns more Australians at risk of heat-related injuries

image.altText: close up of parking machine with lawns in the background

props.synopsis: Machines that require a person's number plate, do not accept cash, and will only issue digital receipts have been installed to replace nearly 300 ticket machines rendered obsolete as the 3G network shut down.

title.children: Rego requirements, digital receipts prompt privacy fears over cashless parking machines

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas speaking on stage to a crowd

props.synopsis: The South Australian parliament has backed laws to strip money out of politics – essentially, out of their own pockets. So how did the bill attract broad political support?

title.children: Taking money out of politics by dipping deeper into the public purse

image.altText: An officer holding a plastic bag containing smaller bags of white powder.

props.synopsis: Australia's largest specialist medical society has called for a number of illicit drugs to be decriminalised across the country.

title.children: 'Whole of society discussion': Peak specialist medical body issues demand for drug decriminalisation

image.altText: The glass facade of a court building bearing a coat of arms.

props.synopsis: The court heard the Sunshine Coast woman was unaware she was committing an offence by failing to report the alleged abuse.

title.children: Mother sentenced for failing to report alleged sexual abuse of eight-year-old daughter

image.altText: Ryan Kobayashi and two women hold pictures of missing woman Hannah Kobayashi.

props.synopsis: Hannah Kobayashi has been seen crossing into Mexico alone with her luggage and is no longer is considered missing, according to police.

title.children: Hannah Kobayashi declared voluntary missing person after being spotted entering Mexico

image.altText: A blonde woman in a blue suit

props.synopsis: Ashley Alsione Ruscoe entered the pleas in Downing Centre Local Court this week, admitting to one count of domestic violence-related assault and one count of stalking or intimidation with intent to cause fear.

title.children: Boxer Harry Garside's ex-girlfriend pleads guilty to assaulting him, apprehended domestic violence order in effect

image.altText: Man with hiking gear smiles and points back/upwards at a mountain full of snow with ski tracks

props.synopsis: Three mountain climbers are missing after they failed to return from a planned ascent of New Zealand's highest peak.

title.children: Search underway for three climbers missing on New Zealand's highest peak

image.altText: A woman with a blonde bob in a face mask hold up two proof of disability cards.

props.synopsis: The founder of Invisible Disabilities Australia says she was "treated appallingly" while going through security at the Canberra Airport, after which she was wheeled into "what can only be described as a cupboard" to be pat down.

title.children: Invisible disability organisation founder says she felt 'violated' going through Canberra Airport security

image.altText: A photo of a regional city with trees and power lines in the foreground

props.synopsis: Nearly 13,000 customers lost power across the far west of NSW this morning after a fault in the electricity network. Some businesses say the uncertainty was too much after experiencing rolling blackouts in October.

title.children: Outback NSW region beset by rolling blackouts for several weeks loses power again

image.altText: A woman in a blue shirt wears a face mask and is being led by police officers in green uniforms through a courtroom

props.synopsis: A court upholds the death penalty sentence against real estate tycoon Truong My Lan as she scrambles to repay billions of dollars.

title.children: 'It makes me shake all over': Alleged fraud victims react after Vietnam's former richest woman loses appeal against death penalty

image.altText: Australia batter Alex Carey plays a pull shot during a Test against India.

props.synopsis: Australia wicketkeeper Alex Carey says he is surprised by the intense reaction to the first-Test loss against India, saying the team has plenty of time to bounce back in the five-Test Border-Gavaskar series.

title.children: Alex Carey and Australia staying calm amid storm over opening loss to India

image.altText: Michelle Heyman high-fives Hayley Raso while playing for the Matildas.

props.synopsis: Interim Matildas coach Tom Sermanni says the team is not particularly well-set-up for the future after having such a settled line-up for the past decade.

title.children: Matildas coach says the team hasn't 'planned for the future well enough'

image.altText: Empty supermarket shelves.

props.synopsis: While shoppers at some Woolworths stores are still encountering empty shelves, the supermarket giant has filed an urgent application with the Fair Work Commission.

title.children: Woolworths reports $50m hit to sales as industrial dispute leaves supermarket shelves bare

image.altText: Trams moving along line in opposite directions on a quiet city street.

props.synopsis: A fallen electrical wire exposing faulty components has halted testing on the $2.9-billion Parramatta light rail project.

title.children: Sydneysiders still waiting for the tram as discovery of widespread defect delays opening yet again

image.altText: Neale Fraser at Wimbledon in 1962

props.synopsis: Australian tennis great Neale Fraser, a winner of 19 major titles, also won the Davis Cup on eight occasions as player or coach between 1959 and 1993.

title.children: 'He was almost like my second dad': Australian 19-time major winner Neale Fraser dies aged 91 after decades nurturing rising talent

image.altText: A man addresses a court with a gallery of people behind him and a chandelier overhead.

props.synopsis: Vanuatu has urged the International Court of Justice to find polluting nations have acted unlawfully by contributing to climate change, in a landmark case that could change future climate talks.

title.children: Vanuatu and Australia diverge in landmark ICJ climate change case

image.altText: Joe Biden wears a white jacket with an American flag on the sleeve and walks with Hunter in front of a leafy background.

props.synopsis: It sounds like a parlour game moral dilemma. But if you're the most powerful man in the world, 82 years old and about to retire, why not save your surviving son from a possible prison sentence?

title.children: With his son's pardon, Joe Biden has ceded the moral high ground and played into Donald Trump's hands

image.altText: Close-up of the cocaine bricks.

props.synopsis: From an unassuming boat moored in the Hervey Bay boat harbour, police were unloading 2.34 tonnes of cocaine — Australia's largest cocaine seizure. But why Hervey Bay?

title.children: A Queensland coastal town becomes the scene of Australia's largest-ever cocaine bust

image.altText: A person's hand holding a mobile phone, showing the Spotify logo.

props.synopsis: Australian music lovers are patiently waiting to see what their year in listening looked like as Spotify teases the release of its 2024 wrap.

title.children: When is Spotify Wrapped 2024 coming out and how can I see it?

image.altText: A man in a yellow and blue shirt sits in a dialysis chair receiving treatment

props.synopsis: Edwin Foster drives a round-trip of 250 kilometres three times a week for kidney dialysis treatment. He's one of thousands rural Australians travelling long distances for the life-saving treatment.

title.children: Rural dialysis patients travelling thousands of kilometres a year to reach treatment

image.altText: Close-up of the cocaine bricks.

props.synopsis: From an unassuming boat moored in the Hervey Bay boat harbour, police were unloading 2.34 tonnes of cocaine — Australia's largest cocaine seizure. But why Hervey Bay?

title.children: A Queensland coastal town becomes the scene of Australia's largest-ever cocaine bust

image.altText: Head shot of a man with slicked-back blonde hair.

props.synopsis: Kristian White, who was found guilty last week of the manslaughter of the 95-year-old, has been removed from the NSW Police Force by Commissioner Karen Webb. The Nowland family has criticised the time the Commissioner took to act.

title.children: 'Too little, too late': Family of Clare Nowland reacts to officer's sacking from NSW Police Force

image.altText: IMAGE Elton John performs on stage

props.synopsis: The Devil Wears Prada Musical has premiered in London's West End but its composer, Sir Elton John, was unable to watch the performance after losing his vision.

title.children: Elton John reveals he is unable to watch his own musical after losing vision

image.altText: A man walking out of court

props.synopsis: Timothy O’Connor faced a two-day committal hearing in the Brisbane Magistrates Court on nearly 60 fraud and child and adult sexual offences.

title.children: Former Brisbane theatre boss faces court on dozens of child and adult sexual offence charges

image.altText: A crocodile basks on the bank of a muddy waterway.

props.synopsis: A 5.12-metre crocodile in Queensland's north could be the largest in captivity in the state following the death of the previous record-holder.

title.children: From runt of the hatchlings to 5.12m monster, a new contender emerges for largest croc in captivity

image.altText: A young woman takes a selfie from her hospital bed

props.synopsis: Despite a cost-of-living crisis, young people aged 25 to 29 have had the biggest take-up of private health insurance over the last year.

title.children: Young people taking up private health insurance in high numbers, reversing 'death spiral' trend

image.altText: A sign that reads "Brisbane Water Secondary College Woy Woy Campus" affixed to a stone wall.

props.synopsis: Three high school students on the New South Wales Central Coast have been taken to hospitals in Gosford and Sydney after suffering burns during a failed experiment.

title.children: Three teens injured after high school science experiment goes wrong

image.altText: Achieving their dream of home ownership through hard work and dedication

props.synopsis: Meatworkers Jordan Cullinane, 23, and Remi Krahenbring, 25, knew they didn't want to be paying off someone else's mortgage, so they put their heads down and started saving.

title.children: 'We saved for this': Young couple crack housing dream
